website_summaries.verdict: From a top manufacturer, this is a fitness tracker/"reward" monitor/watch designed with kids in mind. Syncs with parent's smartphone.
pros: App for parents helps kids manage schedule/chores
cons: Band is too small for older kids
More of a fitness tracker than a smartwatch, so it might not have all the features some kids want

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE REFURBISHED MODELS...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews appeared to be biased and clump together new purchase and refurbished purchase. DO NOT BUT REFURBISHED. For the many dollars spent on Amazon, this is the only bad purchase I feel strongly enough to protest. We have only had this for 2months and it stopped working 2 weeks ago. We have tried 6 different batteries and the vaseline trick that garmin recommended...... after unscrewing and rescrewing 4 TINY screws about 10 times I have given up. While my son loves the app, and loved the device while it worked, this is a rip off. If it was an apple refurbished, there would be ne problem. But as it is, this is a total rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S

customer_reviews.title: Breaks frequently but my kids love them.
customer_reviews.text: We love the Garmin vivofit Jr! My favorite thing is the chores/rewards aspect and the adventure trail. My girls (5 and 8) are obsessed with theirs! The only problem? BREAKAGE. My 5 year old has had two replacements in the past 9 months because hers keeps breaking. My 8 year old's just broke after 9 months, and it had a spot on the screen for 2 months before that. Just be prepared to send them back time and time again for replacement/repair.
customer_reviews.author: Heather K (Dentist in my Spare Time)

customer_reviews.title: I love the free app that allows us to track his ...
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son loves this thing. I was hesitant to purchase because I felt it was very expensive for a child. I love the free app that allows us to track his progress as well as establish chores and rewards. Makes it a little easier to get some help around the house lol. I'd highly recommend this product to anyone with a smaller child. Its water resistant, he never takes it off.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Who certifies these?
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a try. There are over 1000 reviews with most in the 3-5 star range. DOA right out of the box. Who certifies these? The get started guide didn't even refer to how to power the unit on; just how to pair it. Had to go to the Garmin troubleshooting website that stated refer to change the battery. I did reseat the battery, but I am not going to replace the battery on a "certified to be like new" device. Returned it for refund.
customer_reviews.author: MemnochTheRed

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever, and I am 35 years old. My wrist is small enough for me to squeeze this thing in. Then it has been a breeze. I have tried all the fancy ones believe me. Finally settled with this one because - Not needing to charge for a year, Not having to remove for shower and followed by the usual forgetting to put it back on, Not worrying about the charger getting packed while traveling, was waaaaay better deal than having a fancy one with a lot of maintenance. If you have a small wrist (bone structure) like I do, you should give this a try regardless of your age. I am 5 7" 118 lb, runner, travel much.
customer_reviews.author: Lazybug

customer_reviews.title: Systemic display issues
customer_reviews.text: This tracker is great for keeping your kids on task. Unfortunately the longevity of these watches is short-lived. One of these has already been replaced within 2 weeks and now they both need to be replaced because of the display issues. The only recourse is Garmin replacing the defective units. The replacement time frame is a minimum of 2 weeks. In the picture it's pretty evident that the boy is a more rough on the watch but that has no bearing on the defective pixelation of the screen. Preferably I'd like to move up to the new updated and hopefully better functioning model.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbi

customer_reviews.title: my son is very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had to return this product twice. When my son opened it Christmas morning he was thrilled Santa had brought him what he wanted. When we took it out of the box, it was dead. Replaced the battery. Still died 2 days later. We returned it for a replacement and 4 days after that it's not working again. This is ridiculous and now I am returning again and having to replace it in my own re price has gone up. More importantly, my son is very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Annie Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase, no charging necessary!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with the purchase. The first priority was a watch, but the fitness tracker upped the cool factor. Our 10yo daughter has been motivated by her tracker and is definitely moving more. The timer feature has been very handy, her orthodontist wants her brushing 5 minutes after eating. The chores aren't hugely motivating, but she does appreciate hearing the ding as coins are added to her account. I especially like the fact that the vivofit doesn't need to be charged routinely, that's just not likely to happen regularly unless I intervene. I would definitely recommend this tracker. I do sometimes question the accuracy of the activity tracker portion, but it's good enough for a child.
customer_reviews.author: BookLovin'Mom

customer_reviews.title: Beware false advertising.
customer_reviews.text: The product page clearly states that the battery life is 1 year. I bought this at the end of Novemeber and the battery died today. When I reached out to Garmin they were not interested in sending a replacement battery. Amazon on the other hand was also not interested in making it right as the seller. The battery is 1 year guaranteed from the time it was put in the watch. Misleading and dirty advertising. Well done Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LowlyTarbender

customer_reviews.title: This was a birthday present for my daughter and imagine her disappointment when it wouldn’t turn on fresh out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective. This was a birthday present for my daughter and imagine her disappointment when it wouldn’t turn on fresh out of the box. A few days later, we replaced the battery AND still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: ron york

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for about 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about 6 weeks. Now it just gives a triangle every time you try to push the button and change the screen. It won't sync with the device for the app, and now will not update. Garmin has not responded on why this is happening.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the splurge
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Within a day my kids' activity levels have increased 1000% because they have a goal to meet. They have to earn tablet time which has been a constant battle (with us adults usually giving in). I bought this one for my 11 year old and the only complaint was that the band was too small. I found another company that sold replacement bands and it fit right in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor longevity
customer_reviews.text: This developed a small black spot on the screen within the first month and the battery died within 3 months. We contacted customers service. They said the battery is only guaranteed Up to a year. They did send a replacement for the black spot. The replacement died within a month and we replaced the battery. It worked for another two months and then stopped working completely. I loved the step tracking, the watch, and the chore tracker. But the longevity stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work when it showed up. The babysitter and my son tried for hours to get it working while we were on vacation for our wedding. Of course we lost it with all the transitions. Ended up ordering another and after a year it crapped out. Not investing in another.
customer_reviews.author: stacia cross

customer_reviews.title: Died within 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these for the kids Christmas 2017 and I’ve replaced a band and now, not 6 months later, the thing died. The other one has some issues but is still functioning. I called support and the warranty on this is less than 1 year. Major bummer
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

customer_reviews.title: We Love the Vivofit Jr!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this refurbished Vivofit Jr to replace another one. The only reason we needed to replace the other is because our puppy got ahold of it and chewed it up. I was a little worried about ordering refurbished, but this seems to work just as well as the brand new one did. These bands are perfect for little kids and my son love his. He is 8 and it fits perfectly, helps him keep track of time, etc. Highly recommend this simple fitness tracker if you are looking for an easy to wear waterproof watch for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: Leila

customer_reviews.title: You must get this for your child!
customer_reviews.text: You must get this for your child! This is been such a motivator for my child. Are used to have to ask her 10 times to do something. Now she is excited to do chores and rushes to do them just so she can get her points. We have contest to see who walked the most steps. It motivates her and it motivates me.
customer_reviews.author: Mary's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the summer for both my kids (8 and 4 yr old) and they love them. Great to motivate them to do chores and earn coins like a video game. They can complete with each other for steps or how many coins they've earned. You can change the face from the digital time, calendar date, coins earned or steps for the day. The app for parents is easy to use and sync with the watches if needed. So far this has been well worth the money for summer motivation!
customer_reviews.author: Jen W.

customer_reviews.title: This misses most steps! Support is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: My son wore this and would run 1/4 mile. The steps didn't change! It was so hit or miss in what it counted. I called product support and was walked through how to reset it. The lady also informed me that step counters were not that accurate. WTH? That doesn't help, & isn't even true. My child was so excited to run and exercise and wanted to increase his number or steps. It's a waste of money. Buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: E & J

customer_reviews.title: Band broke in just over a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. It's been only slightly over a week since he opened it, and the band has torn completely. Unbelievable. Replacing the band isn't the end if the world, but I certainly shouldn't need to do this after only a week of use. Having said that, my son loves his fitness band and is now anxiously awaiting a replacement band so he can continue using it. I would recommend buying a few extra bands right away. The one that comes with it is not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Dalton

customer_reviews.title: I love this concept
customer_reviews.text: I love this concept. My kids really got into the competitiveness of steps and also acquiring points through the chores. The only thing is that this flower band didn't last but 6 months (I ordered the digi camo for son and flower for daughter), and the replacement bands through Garmin are ridiculous. I will say Garmin product support is VERY good. They do stand behind their products and will replace the unit itself if it malfunctions. I have heard of friends that tried other kid fitness bands and their products lasted weeks or a few months at best, so I think Garmin has a lead there.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Graves

customer_reviews.title: daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch for my daughter. She loves tracking how active she's been and then playing the game on the app. It is nice that you can assign chores and your child can get digital coins deposited in her bank on her watch. Of course it is not real money. You assign an amount and reward. I can't say much about the battery life, as we have only had it for a couple of months. So far we are very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Bands break and battery life is not 1 year :(
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year olddaughter loves her Fitbit, but it is not made well. She has had it for 8 months, and within 5 months, we replaced the bands 2 times. Now she has had it 8 months, and the battery that was supposed to last 1 year is dead. I am very concerned with replacing it myself because she wears it for swim team practice 3-4 times a week. I worry that replacing the battery will cause seal damage. :(
customer_reviews.author: catherine quinn

customer_reviews.title: Some flaws, but good starter watch.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent first activity watch for kids. My kids love the games. We bought 4 different pattern ones. They love to try and get the most steps and they love checkingf their sleep. However, they aren't cheap and only 6 weeks in show a lot of wear one the bands. One kid the band broke already (it snapped and not really from more then average abuse). I will be ordering replacement bands but the true brand ones are expensive. Other then the wear, the kids enjoy them. It has motivated them to be more active. We have several 17,000 step days and only when it rains are they under 10,000.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 7yo son and he loves it. He’s had it for about 6 months and wears it all the time, even swimming and showers. The only issue we’ve had was when the time changed. I did a reset and it fixed it. It’s also been great for him to know what time it is and recognizing big numbers. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: V. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Children approve
customer_reviews.text: In the past I have given this Garmin to all of my 4 granddaughters and they never took it off. They wear it in the shower and when they are in the pool. It keeps them moving and aware of how much they move. They are always comparing their number of steps to mine. I did have to buy them again because they just stopped even with replacing the battery, but the good news is that they wanted the same one again. So, that would be an outstanding review. Because they were a couple of years older they outgrew the bands, so I bought new colorful bands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bogacki

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited to get his fitness tracker, but the band was way too small. Luckily, we had a small adjustable band on hand extra from our fitness trackers. He's a thin 9 year old, and this band would barely fit a toddler's wrist. Too bad it wasn't bigger or even adjustable. The red was his favorite, so we're bummed that didn't work for him. That being said, the actual tracker works great! He loves the dinosaur with his steps and having his name show up on the other screen.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a tracker so he could compare his steps to family members who all have fitbits. However, I wasn't too keen on spending the fitbit price for something not as fun as this. And other brands I've tried are like throwing money in the garbage so I wanted a trusted brand. The app (Vivofit Jr) is great, it gives him something to play for a short time and I like it because I can see his activity level along with his sleeping patterns. There's also opportunity for the kids to earn money if you set it up on the app. We've had this since April and so far no problems. It's been in the lake also.
customer_reviews.author: H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product and concept for kids.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 and he loves this watch. I got it for him as a Christmas present and it has been a huge motivator for him. He loves the look, and the reward system. I only wish he had friends that had the same watch so he could compete a little with them on the activities he is doing. The battery has not run down yet either. Oh and it really is water proof! My son takes it in the pool, the ocean, and the bath all the time. He doesn't really like to take it off. Sometimes it doesn't calculate the active minutes the way I think it should but other than that I am more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: life by rebecca anne

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars - awesome for small 6 YO
customer_reviews.text: Pros: My kid didn’t like the character options on the other version and liked the red design better. I agree. Great fit for very slim 6 year old wrist Interaction with app is good Motivating to do chores Keeps record of child’s sleep and movement in a timeline/graph format tha fis easy to understand Cons Very dim screen Can only set one alarm Seems less “jazzy” than newer version so this kid sometimes is disappointed when comparing it to my garmin or sister’s newer version of this watch
customer_reviews.author: bld424

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The product may be fine, but the one I received already had a child's name in it. I contacted Garmin and they told me the battery was already close to 8 months old. Considering I ordered a new vivofit JR. and the battery life is only expected to be one year, this is not acceptable. I am sending it back and will not re-order through Amazon. You may want to call Garmin and have them check the serial number if you are purchasing this item for your child.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: The band is super small...Buy replacement bands!
customer_reviews.text: I still need to fully play with this and see what it all does, but I needed to right away mention how TINY the band is. My daughter is in 2nd grade and just turned 8. She has average-to-skinny sized wrists and has to stretch the band a ton just to get it around her wrist. And then it is super tight and super hard to get off of her wrist. Thankfully we had bought the pack of 3 replacement bands which are adjustable and much more suitable. Other than that, my daughter is enjoying it so far.
customer_reviews.author: KSH13

customer_reviews.title: The watch is great, the app is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The device itself is great so far. It counts steps and activity as expected. It seems pretty durable and is well sized for a small wrist. It comes out of the band easily enough but not too easily. Unfortunately, it will not sync with the app. I've tried numerous times on multiple devices and it fails every time. So it's unfortunate that you lose a lot of features without the app. The chore tracking and game features are unusable as is sleep tracking. For us, it works well enough that it's not worth the effort of a return, but I can't recommend it to anyone when there are probably more reliable options out there.
customer_reviews.author: B. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: They LOVED THEM.
customer_reviews.text: OMG.........I bought my grandchildren this........4 year old and 2 6 year olds. They LOVED THEM..........wouldn't stop walking around to outdo the other ones steps. I feel this present will last a long time. Their parents loved tracking their sleep and giving them coins for chores done.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: well-designed for kids
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for his 6th birthday - he was begging for a watch that counted his steps, and this does everything for him! The band size is perfect for a normal-size 6 year old (he's in the 75th percentile, so a little bigger) - and he still has room to grow into it. The interface/app are well-designed for children and I like other features - chores, sleep monitoring, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle

customer_reviews.title: This could be a great device. My kids were excited about getting this ...
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great device. My kids were excited about getting this activity tracker. They were competing with each other on the first few days about how many steps and how much activity minutes they could accumulate. However, everyday is like day one. It never seems to sync with my phone in a timely fashion, some days not ever. I have to reset their profile pics everyday. I also can't view a cumulative weekly total of their activities, so it's not really just an expensive pedometer and watch. As far as pedometers go, however, it is a really good one. The kids have tried to cheat it by swinging their arms and it only tracks actual steps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: *battery last less then a month***
customer_reviews.text: It's Easy to use, waterproof works good for swimming and baths ,stoked about the one year battery life, and gets my kid to do his chores the first time I ask. Great Xmas gift. ****Initially we we're stoked about this watch. It was a Christmas present. But my son has had it less then a month and it's showing a triangle, which apparently means, low battery. So much for a one year battery. Making me think I should return this and find him a rechargable watch so I don't have to deal with running for battery's every month.
customer_reviews.author: Nahoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my 7 and 4 YO. I was worried the band wouldn't fit the 4 YO, it fits fine. It tacks their activity, steps, and rewards. A bonus for me is it also tracks their sleeping. I knew my 4YO would get up and not wake me up during the night. I didn't realize he was up 1/2 the night. After a few nights after syncing, I realized he wasn't sleeping. Now we have a better schedule and he's sleeping 8-9 hours and I have a whole new kiddo!! They are easy to use and sync.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter likes the Garmin but the band fell apart ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes the Garmin but the band fell apart within the month. We didn't call Garmin for a replacement because we found inexpensive bands on Amazon. Those have worked well. Overall, my daughter is excited about achieving her daily goals. I have not however used the device to its full capacity or as a skinnerian conditioning device.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son’s 6th birthday. He was so excited to start using it. On the first day, we started getting low battery warnings. We got them again on the second day and now the watch seems to have konked out. I tried contacting Amazon chat support and they said someone will provide me “technical support”. I don’t want to deal with tech support after owning and item for 3 days!! Returning and will see if a replacement is better.
customer_reviews.author: Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke within four months
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVED this watch. It helped us get him out of the house on time each day. So when the strap broke a few months after he got it, he asked us to please get another one. I can't justify buying this same watch three times a year. I'm on hold (for 20 minutes) with Garmin in the hopes they will somehow replace the band.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty mama

customer_reviews.title: Great product! my son is motivated to be active ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! my son is motivated to be active and loves doing chores for the coin rewards that he then uses to play a game with. Not having to charge a battery is wonderful! and I don't have to worry about it getting wet because it is water resistant. It works well, I don't have any problems syncing it to my phone, my only complaint is that the wrist strap is not adjustable. My child has very small wrists and would have liked it even more if it had a real watchband on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Kids fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: This product is GEAT!! The band is waaaay to small so I had to order additional bands so that is why the 4 star. I have set up my daughter who 8 yrs old with chores and school tasks to stay on track and she gets excited when she earns coins for doing them! She competes with her daddy to see if she took more steps than him so it has made her more active and more aware of being active. This is a great tool for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hallock

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. It tracks his steps, active minutes, and sleep. Daily activity minutes make it a fun game. Cons: I have to sync to my phone daily to update information and award points. It doesn't remind him to complete chores. He has ADHD, so reminders would be helpful. I think the newer version may have this feature, however.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after 1 month; don't buy refurbished
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Amazon and they told me someone from Garmin would contact me. That was a month ago and I've heard nothing. The watch was great for the first 3 weeks, but died before my 9 yo son had it for even a month. Don't bother getting refurbished unless you want to waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: YogaGrrl

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old Loves this Garmin Vivofit
customer_reviews.text: This is 2nd Garmin Vivofit I purchased for my grandson. His band broke and the watch part fell into the ocean while he was on vacation. I ordered another just like the one he lost because he wanted the same thing. I also ordered a blue camo replacement band at the same time so he can change it up. He is 8 years old and has a small wrist. PERFECT for him He LOVES it! He doesn't take it off...even to shower! Ordered on Saturday and it was delivered to my door on Sunday, ready for my Grandson's return from Florida. He was without a Vivofit for only a day! Thank you Amazon for great prices and fast service.
customer_reviews.author: D Brown

customer_reviews.title: Son Liked It
customer_reviews.text: Our son like this very much. Since this was a renewed we didn't have great expectations. I did however expect it to make it a full year on the battery. It between a month - month and a half away and it has stopped as of yesterday 5/13/19. It definitely served its purpose and worked great. Only docking because the battery did not make it the year as claimed.
customer_reviews.author: christian winters

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This product is super glitchy. It is constantly creating problems - either in unsyncs, or resets the steps, or earnes coins. My 7 year old is crying again over his lost steps and it's not the first time. It was supposed to motivate them to move more, but it's more upsetting than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Alx77

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one week.
customer_reviews.text: Got these (purchased 2) and the kids love them. Wore for one week with great succcess until one morning woke to a blank screen. Opened the back to check the battery and found water inside. So not as ‘water resistant’ as hoped. Hoping a change in battery will revive the tracker The only reason for the two stars as opposed to one star is for the comfort and ease. Kids enjoyed this week of wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tabetha R. Smith-Nail

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best watch for kids. My daughter is 9 now. She has worn this watch daily never takes it off for 3 years now! The only issue is the battery last 1 year, so we buy a new one every year. It’s worth not having to worry about charging it and so forth though. Waterproof and durable.
customer_reviews.author: kindle

customer_reviews.title: Great watch but horrible battery life (initially)
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this watch and it has helped her to finish her chores and she actually excited to go to bed when the alarm goes off. The only, but major, issue is that the batteries only last for about a month and a half. My advice is to buy the watch but also buy replacement batteries in bulk. UPDATE: Due to the battery drain issue, I contacted Garmin about 9 months after buying the watch and they happily sent me a new watch (sans band). The new watch doesn’t have the batter drain issue.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my son last year. Within three months there was a spot of dead pixels on the screen. Within six months the band was ripping. After a year the screen is difficult to read as the dead spot has grown and the band won't hold the device anymore. For only getting one year of use this was stupidly expensive. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen C.

customer_reviews.title: If the wrist band is too tight, garmin is awesome and will send out another one for free.
customer_reviews.text: My kids each got one for Christmas last year and both love them. They connect to an app on my phone and we both enjoy looking at the data, having family competitions, and reviewing sleep with them. My only issue was the battery died in my one child’s watch after only a few months. But, I did buy another one for him because he was crushed. They are 6 and 8.
customer_reviews.author: Bfsadler

customer_reviews.title: My son was happy when we gave it to him as a present
customer_reviews.text: My son was happy when we gave it to him as a present, when we tried to set it up stopped working, we replaced the battery and it did work for a week and stopped working again, after another battery work for a little longer and stopped again, Garmin is a good brand, still there are some defective, don’t waste your money for something that looks a great price, get it from a reliable store
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch, hate the band!
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch portion. My grandson really stays on the move while he is tracking his steps. My problem is the rubber watch band. I just purchased this last month and he has worn (probably by rubbing) the bottom of the band almost into. I had to take it away from him today until I can purchase another one. The top of the band is extremely sturdy but the bottom more flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Stokes

customer_reviews.title: its what i expect
customer_reviews.text: for this price I expect a good product to do what it promises. Its basically a watch -it keeps time, has the date. It tracks steps, but not very accurately and offers a cute app game(but you need a device for that). In fact, you need the app in order to activate this "watch". Its not as advanced as other products, but costs less than others of comparison. its kinda expensive for a kid. I'm an adult with a very tiny wrist that uses it as a watch and occasionally track steps. best feature is its waterproof...I rarely take it off. Every year I replace the battery. its easy to replace myself for about a $1.50 battery.
customer_reviews.author: terry m.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage battery dead upon opening
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my kid for his birthday today and the stupid thing won’t even turn on.... I like how the packaging talks about the long lasting battery. But it looks like mine is dead on arrival. What a piece of junk! He was so excited to start playing with it and now we have a junky rubber band that does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof? Check!  No charging? Check!  Fun? Check!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are huge fans of the Garmin Vivofit Jr! This year my daughter is getting one, and joining the wearable step tracker club! I love that they are waterproof, don’t need to be charged, and slip on their small wrists. They love the goals, coins and styles. We all love competing with one another and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. I would highly recommend this product for anyone who has children who show interest in being active! It’s also at a great price point! You can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Quitno

customer_reviews.title: Good product except for the band!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and I ended up buying a second one for another kid. It is great to track my kids’ sleep. And the chores and rewards are a nice way to promote independence. The only negative is that the band is super small and I had to buy new bands for my 6 year old son and same sized 9!year old daughter. I love that they do not need to be charged!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoy

customer_reviews.title: I like how you can create your own chores and rewards ...
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this watch. She is able to set timers for herself to help her stay on track. We are able to give reward incentives for keeping up with her chores and daily responsibilities. I like how you can create your own chores and rewards and don't just have to choose from a list. She has fun tracking her steps and and meeting her daily activity goal as well so she can move her character another step in the game. Great durable product. Now her little sister wants one too!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey C.

customer_reviews.title: This is garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted less than a month. I have replaced the battery twice. Now it doesn’t even work. It makes me so angry. Everything stopped working once the return window closed. This is garbage. Do not buy. It will just disappoint your kids.
customer_reviews.author: M. Merrell

customer_reviews.title: Get this watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is SO FUN. My 5 year old daughter loves it! She loves seeing how many active minutes she gets each day, and the chores/coins have been more enticing to her than I realized they would be. I can't say enough great things about this watch and fitness tracker and have recommended it to all of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Bean

customer_reviews.title: The Glass Scratches Way Too Easy!
customer_reviews.text: OK so everything about this watch is great EXCEPT when it says 'kid durable' ! My son barely brushed his hand against the exterior wall of our house on accident while wearing the watch and the glass completely scratched! I tried using a wax to buff out the scratch because he was so upset and it didn't remove enough of the scratch to be able to read the screen. I wish the glass was a higher quality / scratch proof material considering this is marketed for active kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WAAAY to small for my 10 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Said it was ages 9-11 give or take. My son is 10 and he was in the fit age range. This product was so small I don’t know what child it would actually fit! It wasn’t adjustable and no other band. It fit snugly around a golf balls. That’s how small it was! Had to return it. We were very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan greer

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this watch for a long run
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this watch for a long run, is not even a year and the watch stopped working, changed the battery,worked for one month and stopped working all together. My 11 year old daughter and me are disappointed. Bad quality. For the price should last longer. I did not paid for a disposable watch but that is what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Stephany

customer_reviews.title: Device is nifty, but wrist band is toddler sized.
customer_reviews.text: The devices seems to work well, but the wrist band was tiny. I purchased it for my 9 year old, but he could barely get his hand through. So tight it cut off circulation. I had to order an off-brand larger replacement band. Now he can use it. The chore function hasn't been used because he can't manage it from the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Q.

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my 9 1/2 year old. I was worried about it fitting after reading other reviews about it being small, but all of the adjustable bands had princesses or minnie mouse on them, so that wasn't going to work either. This works perfectly and she loves it! It's a great gift and totally age-appropriate gadget- no internet! Encourages chores and has timers for brushing teeth, reading, etc... Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MeetMeInTheStacks

customer_reviews.title: For my 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: Daughter got this watch for Christmas and LOVES it. It allows her to track her steps during the day and compete with her sister. It has an alarm that goes off when she hits her daily goal. Stretchy band and it fits her tiny wrist nicely. I like that it doesn't have a buckle so she can put it on by herself. Fits like a bracelet.
customer_reviews.author: SSJ

customer_reviews.title: Do not order this from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Don’t order this product from Amazon, use another vendor. I bought this same watch for my 9 year old son. 9 month battery life, great product. However; ordered the same one for my 6 year old for Christmas and it arrived with a dead battery. Amazon was great, and happy to replace. The problem is that this product obviously sat on a shelf in their warehouse for a year. I wish i had ordered it from Walmart because I could of physically exchanged the product same day. Instead, I have a sad 6 year old on Christmas Day.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Useful, cute, but not reliable or durable
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old had no problems learning to use this. It’s a little snug on my 8 year old’s wrist, but she seems okay with it. I’ve been pretty unhappy with the durability. I bought 2 for Christmas presents. Both had white scuffs on the face by the end of day 1. One was completely dead by mid- January.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! My son
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My son, 6 years old, was completely motivated to collect coins and earn steps while wearing this Fitbit. The only issue I have with it is that is fits like a sausage casing on his wrist and after a day of wearing it at this point (we have had it for about 6 months), the rubber is starting to smell from the sweat that accumulates. I would suggest making it a breathable wristband and adjustable. Other than that, great item!
customer_reviews.author: lascanio

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but not as good at it seems...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this watch for my 5 year old son, who is big on getting tasks finished. We imagined the watch giving symbols throughout the day when chores were set up to be completed. We understood that the phone app was to organize these chores and thought the watch would then give a symbols to remind the wearer to do them. This is not so. The watch is basically a fitness tracking device. The chore charts, and completion all happen within the app, not on the watch itself. The other let down we had was the watch face. It got scratched the very first day my son wore the watch. Not great quality. We are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Elizabeth Stout

customer_reviews.title: Does not count steps accurately, very small fit
customer_reviews.text: Step counter was very inaccurate. Counted over 1000 steps when we drove somewhere in the car. My son wore it for an hour and he had thousands of step despite most of that being a car ride. Also fits very small, my son is 9 and it was too tight. Had it been accurate and worth it I would have ordered a larger band but it wasn’t worth the money so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail G

customer_reviews.title: Cute product, quite durable!
customer_reviews.text: We got this in August and the band and battery only lasted about 6 months. It was easy to replace both though, and they were worn (by my incredibly active 8 year old) nearly round the clock during those 6 months. Her friends have the same activity tracker and love it as well. And the app is adorable!
customer_reviews.author: CandaceW

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Use for my 6 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Bought for my 6 (almost 7 year old). I just want to instill in him the importance of being active and this band is really cool. It allows you to give your children points for doing chores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a month now and my 7 year old loves his watch! He is constantly trying to beat his previous steps (and mine too) and uses the timer for anything and everything. It's great that he can run through the sprinkler and shower with it as well. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LK30

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is 6 and the watch fits her perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 6 and the watch fits her perfectly. We haven't utilized all the aspects of it with chores and such, but she loves knowing the time and seeing how active she's been. So far, she's wearing it everyday! My 4 year old wanted to wear it one day when her sister wasn't, but it wasn't long before we realized the 4 year old had a harder time keeping up with it. We're gonna wait a little bit before she gets one. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Garmin itself
customer_reviews.text: Love the Garmin itself, but the straps are awful and don’t last they just wear thin and literally crumble and snap. We’ve gone through 2 more straps since buying the original - it’s just not worth buying any more. Was a Christmas gift ilast replacement band crumbled beginning of April. Shame as my son loves this Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony

customer_reviews.title: The kids love it
customer_reviews.text: The band is pretty small, I bought this for a birthday gift and decided to order extra bands after it came in due to the band being so small. It did end up fitting her but it is very fitted. She is 6 and the best options I found for her are the adjustable size bands. So far it does everything it says it does and we have had no issues with it. The app is also very easy to use and set goals. I will be buying another one for the next childs birthday
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasted 3 days max, terrible
customer_reviews.text: I would expect that a battery would have been replaced in a refurbished item, but apparently not. The device lasted only a 3 days. My son was super excited to get this for Christmas and has really increased his physical activity. I purchased a refurbished one for my oldest son 6 months ago and the battery is still going strong. I’m debating returning the item all together or replacing the battery myself.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 5 year old daughter for her birthday and she loves it! She's motivated every day to reach her goal of 60 minutes of exercise so she can get a new clue about an animal. She's excited to do chores and collect coins to trade in for rewards. It fits her wrist nicely and it's waterproof (she's worn it in the shower, pool and ocean). Love, love love this!!
customer_reviews.author: smilenone1

customer_reviews.title: Hit the buy now button!
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this for 2 months now, and it's been simply awesome. Worn on multiple occasions for extended periods of time in all kinds of water without issue. The chore option was an even bigger hit than I could have imagined and has provided structure where there was once very little. Can't say enough good things about it, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A.R.

customer_reviews.title: wish they were more clear on what sofware requirements are
customer_reviews.text: Got for out daughter. Figured set up/syncing would be a cinch....nope. neither of our phones, laptops nor the tablet are able to support the app. Called support and their recommendation was to upgrade our phones. Well...great. good thing we convinced grandma to let us use her new tablet until we can upgrade, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: MollieOllieOxenFree

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. My daughter is on the swim team so it was important for it to be water proof. We’ve had it about 9 months now. It goes in the water almost every day and we’ve had no issues. Love that she can use it as her alarm clock. The rewards are cool too but the novelty of that has worn off a bit. Can’t believe it only cost $50.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C Price

customer_reviews.title: pity- It was a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these and the 2 for my nieces were excellent! They love them. However, the watch for my daughter is a lemon. It doesn't allow any battery to hold a charge and we've gone through 5 in 5 months. She very frustrated. When I tried to contact Garmin about it (just 4 months after buying it here on amazon,) they say that the 1-year warranty is expired. I've learned my lesson- don't buy appliances from amazon.com, but a pity that my daughter doesn't get the watch she wanted for Christmas... (2 stars accounting for the 2 watches that have been a success!)
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Orris

customer_reviews.title: One size does not fit all. My daughter is ...
customer_reviews.text: One size does not fit all. My daughter is seven but, as it happens, is on the small end of the body scale. It may be a year or two before she can wear this item and, while you can upgrade to a larger band, there are no smaller bands.
customer_reviews.author: Old DufflerTop Contributor: DC Comics

customer_reviews.title: Band a little tight
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a five star rating but I believe the band is just a tad too tight. I don't think it's a good fit for one band fits all. I must say that the gift was a success as my grandson loved it.
customer_reviews.author: pickginger

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old LOVES it! The chore option is cool and he enjoys getting the 'coin' rewards. The set up was super easy, but something happened and I had to do it again a few days later that upset him because he lost his steps for the day. I'm not super happy with the sleep tracker. It's not as accurate as the fitbit. over all great buy. He's happy, so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jess S. Belder

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it... but battery didn't last anywhere near as described
customer_reviews.text: My 6-year-old son loves tracking his fitness with this. The battery unfortunately stopped working after 2 months, which was extremely disappointing. But shout out to Garmin's customer service for replacing the device right away! Hopefully this one actually last a year
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Rest ban on adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I'm fortunately this cut the circulation of on my 8 year old so I think is made for children were very small arms or wrist I went and upgrade it to the next level and the Van broke on that there's better products out there
customer_reviews.author: JEO

customer_reviews.title: The app on the ipad works well and the ability to assign chores and rewards has made this Mom love it as well
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has worn this every day since she received it on Christmas and loves everything about it!!! The app on the ipad works well and the ability to assign chores and rewards has made this Mom love it as well!
customer_reviews.author: BizzBooBoo

customer_reviews.title: Battery low in 7 days
customer_reviews.text: This was a great looking product. My daughter wanted a fitbit, but was using her money and researched the vívofit jr. She convinced me it was a good deal, so I let her buy it. We received the product on Aug 24th and on Aug 31st (of the same year) I get a notification on my app that the battery is low. ..the batter that is supposed to last a year before replacing! I know I can go buy another battery, but think it you advertise 1 year, it should be 1 year, not 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not water resistant if your kid is swimming!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her Vivofit! She has had it for a little over a year and we already had to replace battery twice. It doesn’t always connect to my phone so we have to synch it manually. The only thing is that is not water resistant. It stopped working after swimming classes this summer. We are a little disappointed that it stopped working while she was in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Zorica Trbic

customer_reviews.title: Digit screen glitched after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This was my son’s second Vívofit Jr. The first one lasted a full year without even needed a new battery, and then survived a second year He went through several bands in that time but the actual digital portion was fine. The Vívofit JR he got for Christmas 2018 has already stopped working, the digital screen is “glitched” and although we have tried replacing batteries and it is on, the screen does not work. VERY disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: BHT

customer_reviews.title: Band rubs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's birthday. (Age 8 with a small wrist). His dad & older brother have Garmin Vivifit watches, and he wanted one too. Unfortunately, the watch band has rubbed his wrist and left a big, red "burn" sore. He had to stop wearing it so thr sure could heal. We like the watch but wish it had a different band that didn't rub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Kids Tracker Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: My child LOVES this tracker. She received this as a present for her 6th birthday. Super easy to wear and use. No problems syncing with my phone. She received several replacement bands, which are easy enough to switch out daily to match her outfit. I was considering purchasing one for my 2 year old as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Schilling

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed with that
customer_reviews.text: A little too big for my 5-year-old granddaughter at first, but she is very excited to wear it. I bought different color-bands for my young grandsons (6 & 8). Both of them wore the bands out before they were a year old. A little disappointed with that.
customer_reviews.author: Kaci

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished as good as new!
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked how perfect the refurbished one is that just arrived. I took a chance on the cheaper, refurbished one, because younger son wanted what older son had. But not for $100. Spent a third of that on the whim that it would be just okay enough for my son. But its mint condition. So happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to pay $30 for 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved being able to track her steps & keep up with the time. The band held up great. I has been worn everyday without taking it off. It has a internal battery that has lasted less than 3 months. I purchased my one as well. Same use as his sister. He is still operating.
customer_reviews.author: angel lewis

customer_reviews.title: My step daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great because it encourages kids to do things they tend to forget (such as chores, brushing the teeth etc) by positive reinforcement (they get rewards for doing things). Plus it gives the challenges to do a minimal daily physical acitvity (steps per day) and the child discovers animals by doing a virtual hike everyday. Plus the band is colorful and cute. My stepdaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: namouze

product_meta.title: Garmin vívofit jr, Kids Fitness/Activity Tracker, 1year Battery Life, Red, Broken Lava
product_meta.description: Color:Broken Lava| Style:NewLet's get kids on the move. Meet the activity tracker just for kids, vívofit jr. It’s swim friendly, durable and features kid-approved designs, a 1-year battery life and a free, parent-controlled mobile app. The app motivates your pint-sized powerhouses to stay on the move with rewards and a mobile adventure trail to unlock. Meanwhile, parents can monitor steps and sleep and get a Summary of their kids 60-minute daily activity goal. The app also gives parents the ability to manage and assign chores and give rewards to positively enforce good behavior. It's all easily controlled from Mom and dad’s Compatible Apple or Android mobile devices. Do not place in high temperature environments, such as a clothes dryer
feature_bullets: Ages 4—9 years; Bands: Regular size accommodates wrists up to 145 mm; X large fits wrists 146 170 mm. vívofit 3 bands are compatible
1 year battery life no recharging needed
24/7 wearability swim friendly with 5 ATM water resistance. Strap material silicone
Kid tough easy to put on, the 1 size fits most, nonstaining, 1 piece band stretches over your child’s hand and fits comfortably

Compatible parent mobile app free app includes fun and educational mobile adventures for kids and chore/behavior management for parents; OS compatible Android 4.4 and above with Bluetooth 4.0 or greater or iPhone OS version 9.1 and above

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,901 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
